text: Jamshid Giunashvili (; 1 May 1931 - 21 January 2017). He was a Georgian linguist, Iranologist, researcher, author, and diplomat. He having served as the first ambassador of Georgia to Iran for a period of ten years from 1994 through 2004. == Biography == Giunashvili was born in Tehran, Iran. He graduated from Tbilisi State University with a doctors degree in Iranian studies.ფერეიიდანი, ჯემშიდ გიუნაშვილი - მეგობრობის მაცნე (in Georgian) Giunashvili died on 21 January 2017 in Tbilisi, Georgia, aged 86.Georgian Iranologist Jamshid Giunashvili dies at 86 ==Related pages== *List of Asian scientists by country ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Scientists from Georgia (country) Category:Linguists Category:Ambassadors Category:People from Tehran Category:Georgian diplomats
title: Jamshid Giunashvili
